info.name: Cuneus gyrus
info.description: The cuneus gyrus is a wedge-shaped area of occipital cerebral cortex between the parieto-occipital and calcarine sulci. It forms the superior bank of the calcarine sulcus which receives visual input from lower visual fields.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/11 Brain stem - mid-sagittal view
/Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/12 Brain stem - parasagittal view
